Name: Black-topped red ware bowl
Description: Black-topped red ware bowl. This type of smooth pottery with black inner surface and black-topped red exterior has a long and varied history. These elegant vessels with extremely thin walls, all of which were made without the use of a potter's wheel, were originally also found in Egypt, though only in Predynastic times. Like so many other things, they survived in Nubia, while in dynastic Egypt other techniques and shapes developed.
